text: Vaso-occlusive Crisis: Occurs when sickle red blood cells slow or stop flow within blood vessels Aplastic Crisis: Caused by Parvovirus B19; bone marrow does not produce enough red blood cells Splenic Sequestration: Sickle red blood cells build up within the spleen resulting in an enlarged spleen Acute Chest Syndrome: A vaso-occlusive crisis LUEIRICTIERT QIR R Ve EXeE TR N oAl Cler(lely]
